# Task

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.



# Data

timezone_bumper(DateTime(2023, 4, 10, 12, 0),3)

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int = 3)
    if isa(dt, Date)
        throw(ErrorException("timezone_bumper can only be applied to DateTime types. For Date types, use the `Date` function with the desired timezone offset."))
    end
    return dt + Duration(bump * 3600)  # Adding 3600 seconds (1 hour) for each bump
end

timezone_bumper(DateTime(2023, 4, 10, 12, 0)) == DateTime(2023, 4, 10, 15, 0)  # Checking default behavior with +3 hours bump

timezone_bumper(DateTime(2023, 4, 10, 12, 0), -2) == DateTime(2023, 4, 10, 10, 0)  # Checking custom behavior with -2 hours bump
